Description: Typical range for industrial Nd:YAG laser cleaning of ceramics like Zirconia to remove contaminants without thermal damage; starting at 150 W for controlled ablation. Max safe ~500 W to avoid cracking due to low thermal conductivity. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and study in Journal of Laser Applications (2018).
Near-IR wavelength with good absorption in Zirconia for efficient cleaning
Optimal beam spot diameter for precision cleaning of Zirconia surfaces
High repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage while maintaining thermal control
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal with minimal substrate damage
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap percentage for uniform cleaning without excessive heat accumulation
